item.title: GnuPG
item.description: Maybe you’ve heard of GPG, or is it PGP? You’ve probably heard a little more about NSA leaks and put the sloppy password management at work to the back of your mind. Your home password situation is probably not much better. How many passwords do you use for all your...

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve --watch, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site...

item.title: My first post.
item.description: Hello, Jekyll blogging. Now it’s time to figure out how to get the blogger posts imported.

item.title: Analog Zen - Harlan Iverson's Programmer Portfolio
item.description: Analog Zen - Harlan Iverson's Programmer PortfolioI rebuilt my portfolio website using the latest Angular + Bootstrap3 seed project. It was previously written in a pre-1.0 version of Ember + Bootstrap2. I’ll be adding more demos, code samples, and project descriptions this week.

item.title: To carousel or not to carousel?
item.description: To carousel or not to carousel?I think this is a good discussion of website carousels and their types and uses, and good practices for each: While About pages are extremely important, I’m afraid they don’t belong in any sort of carousel – so you can forget that. Remember that each...

item.title: Preserving TypeScript/CoffeeScript Source Map through UglifyJS.
item.description: Preserving TypeScript/CoffeeScript Source Map through UglifyJS.I was pleased to see that UglifyJS can transform the source map from TypeScript through to the Optimized JS: --in-source-map Input source map, useful if you're compressing JS that was generated from some other original code. The motivator was that I am getting ready to...

item.title: How to handle EmberJS actions with a nested VIew, rather than the parent Route.
item.description: How to handle EmberJS actions with a nested VIew, rather than the parent Route.This isn’t hard or hacky, just confusing to a n00b. Views and Routes have events added to them differently, but the real trick is that actions don’t seem to hit the view from whom’s template they originated....

item.title: How to allow non-root users to control Upstart services, without a sudo password prompt.
item.description: How to allow non-root users to control Upstart services, without a sudo password prompt.The snippet that I’m using is here, but this will apply to running any privileged command without a password: youruser ALL = (root) NOPASSWD: /sbin/start yourservice, /sbin/stop yourservice, /sbin/restart yourservice I did not previously know that sudoers allowed rules at...

item.title: Auto re-compiling/re-launching NodeTS setup
item.description: These are my steps that I’ve derived; if you have a better way, please let me know. d: dev box, s: server box: s: install NodeJS (via NVM), and ‘screen’ s: create an empty directory: /path/to/app. s: npm install -g nodemon typescript d: create server.ts with simple “hello world” code...

item.title: UI and Presentation Skills++ with ImpressJS, Strut, and Prezi
item.description: These two tools are pretty awesome for simple developers like myself! I feel empowered make some pretty fancy presentations and UI effects. Here are the best resources I found: nice summary of solutions: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6283964/html-5-javascript-flowchart-tools-prezi-style motivational: http://usersknow.blogspot.com/2013/04/10-reasons-founders-should-learn-to.html ImpressJS: http://bartaz.github.io/impress.js Strut: (build ImpressJS HTML) http://tantaman.com/Strut/dist/index.html Prezi: http://prezi.com/

item.title: Spreadsheet Powered Portfolio
item.description: For the past few weeks I have been updating my frontend web skills. While building an EmberJS+Bootstrap based portfolio, I came across TimelineJS which loads data from Google Spreadsheets! It was the first time I had seen such a trick, and naturally I wanted to figure out how it works....

item.title: Augmented Reality in a Contact Lens - IEEE Spectrum
item.description: Augmented Reality in a Contact Lens - IEEE SpectrumA new generation of contact lenses built with very small circuits and LEDs promises bionic eyesight Cool tech to bring the sci-fi concept film Sight one step closer to reality—recommended viewing, about 8 minutes long!

item.title: STEAM: A Framework for Teaching Across the Disciplines
item.description: STEAM: A Framework for Teaching Across the DisciplinesDespite the throwback website, we need this—check out the video! The way few non-CSE departments at the U would touch STEM concepts and courses in CSE rarely touched non-STEM, was just wrong. STEM is what the world is made of, and Art can...
